Package com.project.appointmentscheduler.controller

Class AppointmentController

java.lang.Object
com.project.appointmentscheduler.controller.AppointmentController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class AppointmentController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Controls interactions between Appointment window and items in the model and DAO

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Sets appointment table to display all appointments. Adds event handler for appointment selected in table. LAMBDA A lambda expression is used as the event handler for appointment selection. A lambda is used here as shorthand to set the selected appointment to eliminate the need for a small event handler method. This simplifies the code and shortens it by using only the single line of necessary code to set the assigned appointment.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known.
      resourceBundle - The resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized.

    • onAllAppointmentSelection

      public void onAllAppointmentSelection(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Displays all appointments from database in appointment table.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the action that triggered the button

    • onMonthAppointmentSelection

      public void onMonthAppointmentSelection(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Displays appointments for current month in appointment table. The current month is the current calendar month.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the action that triggered the button

    • onWeekAppointmentSelection

      public void onWeekAppointmentSelection(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Displays appointments for current week in appointment table. The current week is defined as today through 7 days from now.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the action that triggered the button

    • onNew

      public void onNew(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Redirects to the New Appointment window.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the action that triggered the button
      Throws:
      IOException - if an input or output exception occurs

    • onUpdate

      public void onUpdate(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Redirects to the Update Appointment window if an appointment is selected in the table. If no appointment is selected, an error message is shown.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the action that triggered the button
      Throws:
      IOException - if an input or output exception occurs

    • onDelete

      public void onDelete(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Deletes the appointment currently selected in the appointments table. If no appointment is selected, there is an issue with the deletion, or the appointment cannot be deleted for any reason, an alert error is thrown. Upon confirmation of successful deletion, a notification is given indicating the appointment type and ID that was removed from the database.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the action that triggered the button

    • getSelectedAppointment

      public static Appointment getSelectedAppointment()
      Provides the currently selected appointment to requester.
      Returns:
      the Appointment that is currently selected

    • clearSelectedAppointment

      public static void clearSelectedAppointment()
      Deselects the currently selected appointment.

      Redirects user to Main Menu.
      Parameters:

      Throws:

    • signOut

      public void signOut(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Redirects user to Login window. Current user is unassigned.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the action that triggered the button
      Throws:
      IOException - if an input or output exception occurs
